qas.question: When did many alpine countries develop heavy protection to prevent new invasion?
Who built a series of fortifications in the Maurienne valley?
Why were a series of fortifications in the Maurienne valley built?

answers.text: to protect the major alpine passes

qas.question: Who ordered the construction of a paved road?

context: <a0_0>After the fall of Napoléon<a0_0/>, many alpine countries developed heavy protections to prevent any new invasion. Thus, <a1_0>Savoy<a1_0/> built a series of fortifications in the Maurienne valley in order <a2_0>to protect the major alpine passes<a2_0/>, such as the col du Mont-Cenis that was even crossed by, Charlemagne and his father to defeat the Lombarts. The later indeed became very popular after the construction of a paved road ordered by <a3_0>Napoléon Bonaparte<a3_0/>. The Barrière de l'Esseillon is a serie of forts with heavy batteries, built on a cliff with a perfect view on the valley, a gorge on one side and steep mountains on the other side.
